match.title: 5th match

image.caption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium
image.longCaption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium, Mirpur, October 15, 2009

match.hoursInfo: 12:00 start, First Session 12.00-15.30, Interval 15.30-16.15, Second Session 16.15-19.45

headshotImage.caption: Blessing Muzarabani player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Blessing Muzarabani player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal st Taylor b Cremer 76 (105b 6x4 0x6) SR: 72.38

dismissalComment.html: outfoxes him! Cremer gets another one with the googly. Good length ball on off stump, hung up generously and dipping fast. Tamim steps out and wants to slog this over the midwicket boundary, but it turns away from him and he's woefully out of shape by the end of it all. Easy stumping for Taylor

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan st Taylor b Sikandar Raza 51 (80b 6x4 0x6) SR: 63.75

dismissalComment.html: tossed up full outside off, and entices Shakib to come down the ground. Attempts to lift this over the bowler's head but deceived by the spin! Turns away from his bat, and the keeper stumps him with ease. Raza with the breakthrough
full on off stump, tries to sweep and takes the top edge. Deceived by the pace in the air, and it's caught by short fine leg

trapped in front by a googly. Doesn't pick it as he pushes forward on the front foot. He's convinced that he has no bat on this. He's walking off. Half-stride with bat behind the pad as he shapes to leave what he thinks is a legbreak outside off. Trapped right in front of off stump and that's another plumb lbw wicket this innings

outfoxes him! Cremer gets another one with the googly. Good length ball on off stump, hung up generously and dipping fast. Tamim steps out and wants to slog this over the midwicket boundary, but it turns away from him and he's woefully out of shape by the end of it all. Easy stumping for Taylor

looks like Cremer has his 100th ODI wicket. But we have to wait for confirmation because Mashrafe has reviewed this caught behind decision. This straightens in the corridor and he pokes the bat out. There is a slight sound as it passes the bat....and UltraEdge confirms that. He didn't look sure about hitting that, and asked the partner if there was a sound. But there's enough evidence. He's out

headshotImage.caption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: plumb! Beaten on the inside edge as he plonks the front leg across yet again. This length ball pitches in the corridor and nips back in. He's caught playing the wrong line and is struck dead in front of off stump. No doubt about that, and his partner tells him

Ervine has plucked out a stunner! This is something! He's leaped one-handed to his left at short midwicket and somehow got his hand under it. Superb. It's a short ball from Jarvis, on a middle and off line. The pull shot is nailed off the middle of the bat and dips on Ervine, but he's got down rapidly and done this with some craft. Despite the speed at which he had to move, he completes the catch nicely with a soft landing and a firm elbow

is that an edge? Yes it is! Bangladesh sliding rapidly. Offcutter dug in at short of a length and wide outside off. Grips the surface and climbs up as Nasir brings out the late cut. Once again he's through the shot early and the ball kisses the outside edge on the way up. Dips in front of Taylor who scoops it up

headshotImage.caption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque lbw b Jarvis 1 (7b 0x4 0x6) SR: 14.28

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Muzarabani b Cremer 18 (25b 0x4 1x6) SR: 72

dismissalComment.html: full on off stump, tries to sweep and takes the top edge. Deceived by the pace in the air, and it's caught by short fine leg

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah lbw b Cremer 2 (7b 0x4 0x6) SR: 28.57

dismissalComment.html: trapped in front by a googly. Doesn't pick it as he pushes forward on the front foot. He's convinced that he has no bat on this. He's walking off. Half-stride with bat behind the pad as he shapes to leave what he thinks is a legbreak outside off. Trapped right in front of off stump and that's another plumb lbw wicket this innings

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal st Taylor b Cremer 76 (105b 6x4 0x6) SR: 72.38

dismissalComment.html: outfoxes him! Cremer gets another one with the googly. Good length ball on off stump, hung up generously and dipping fast. Tamim steps out and wants to slog this over the midwicket boundary, but it turns away from him and he's woefully out of shape by the end of it all. Easy stumping for Taylor

Despite the speed at which he had to move, he completes the catch nicely with a soft landing and a firm elbow

He didn't look sure about hitting that, and asked the partner if there was a sound. But there's enough evidence. He's out

image.longCaption: Blessing Muzarabani player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Blessing Muzarabani player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Blessing Muzarabani player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sunzamul Islam c Muzarabani b Chatara 19 (24b 3x4 0x6) SR: 79.16

dismissalComment.html: taken at short fine by Muzarabani. If the Leaning Tower ever falls, it'll look like that. Chatara bounces the advancing batsman who can't connect on the hook. Top edge hangs up and to the right of Muzarabani, who follows it like he's in a trance, stretches out his long hands, takes the catch and falls down in slo-mo

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza b Mustafizur Rahman 39 (59b 4x4 1x6) SR: 66.1

dismissalComment.html: drags it on. Picks the offcutter and plays what he will think is a poor shot. It's back of a length and climbing up wide outside off. He walks into it and can't get on top of the bounce. This is especially important, because the shot he's looking to play is a flick. The ball's going away from him all the time. He can only manage an inside edge onto leg stump

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Cremer lbw b Rubel Hossain 23 (31b 3x4 0x6) SR: 74.19

dismissalComment.html: there can be no doubt here. Cremer stuck in the crease. The ball skids in, too quick for him as he looks to flick. On the knee roll, in front of middle stump. Umpires gives it
you miss, I hit! Slow and loopy on middle stump. Mire tries to slog this far too early, and plays through even before the ball got to him. Sneaks under his bat, and crashes into middle stump

on a hat-trick! Gone first ball! Full on middle stump, but Taylor's gone back instead of coming forward. Misses the flick off his pads, and the ball raps him on the pads. Impact in front of the stumps, and Taylor's walking back. Easy lbw decision for the umpire. Taylor's horrid form continues
easily taken at cow corner! Full on middle and Chatara goes for the slog, comes off the bat's toe end and it's only going down the throat of the man at wide long on

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: drags it on. Picks the offcutter and plays what he will think is a poor shot. It's back of a length and climbing up wide outside off. He walks into it and can't get on top of the bounce. This is especially important, because the shot he's looking to play is a flick. The ball's going away from him all the time. He can only manage an inside edge onto leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: pocketed by mid off! And it's all over. Full on off stump and smacked over the bowler's head. But no real power behind that. Taken by mid off with ease!

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza c Sabbir Rahman b Mashrafe Mortaza 5 (15b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: there's the big one! Back of a length outside off, angling away from Hammy after pitching. He tried to punch at it, but it's so far away from his body. Takes a thick outside edge, and easily pocketed by first slip

dismissalText.commentary: Solomon Mire b Shakib Al Hasan 7 (22b 0x4 0x6) SR: 31.81

dismissalComment.html: you miss, I hit! Slow and loopy on middle stump. Mire tries to slog this far too early, and plays through even before the ball got to him. Sneaks under his bat, and crashes into middle stump

dismissalText.commentary: Brendan Taylor lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: on a hat-trick! Gone first ball! Full on middle stump, but Taylor's gone back instead of coming forward. Misses the flick off his pads, and the ball raps him on the pads. Impact in front of the stumps, and Taylor's walking back. Easy lbw decision for the umpire. Taylor's horrid form continues

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Craig Ervine c Sabbir Rahman b Mashrafe Mortaza 11 (15b 2x4 0x6) SR: 73.33

dismissalComment.html: sharp take from first slip! Back of a length on off stump, he goes chasing behind the ball that's angling away. Takes a thick outside edge, and the ball was dipping on the fielder, but he dives forward to complete an excellent catch. Zimbabwe in big trouble

dismissalText.commentary: Peter Moor lbw b Sunzamul Islam 14 (42b 1x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: given out lbw. Slides past his inside edge and strikes him in front of middle stump. He was looking to defend for the turn and completely missed the line of this slider. Huge gap between bat and pad

dismissalText.commentary: Malcolm Waller lbw b Sunzamul Islam 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: lbw review. Waller has looked to play the paddle sweep first up and missed it. Looks to be struck on a middle stump line. The ball hasn't risen too much. I reckon the only way he survives this is if he has got bat or glove on it. We're waiting for Ultra Edge...no bat involved. Tracking has him dead in front. That's hitting middle and off. He's gone.

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Cremer lbw b Rubel Hossain 23 (31b 3x4 0x6) SR: 74.19

dismissalComment.html: there can be no doubt here. Cremer stuck in the crease. The ball skids in, too quick for him as he looks to flick. On the knee roll, in front of middle stump. Umpires gives it

dismissalComment.html: pocketed by mid off! And it's all over. Full on off stump and smacked over the bowler's head. But no real power behind that. Taken by mid off with ease!

dismissalText.commentary: Kyle Jarvis c Mahmudullah b Mustafizur Rahman 10 (19b 1x4 0x6) SR: 52.63

commentTextItems.html: pocketed by mid off! And it's all over. Full on off stump and smacked over the bowler's head. But no real power behind that. Taken by mid off with ease!

commentPostTextItems.html: 7.06 pm That's all from Mirpur for today. Hope you enjoyed ESPNcricinfo's coverage of the fifth game from this Tri-nation series. For now, it's good bye from Ranjith P, Varun Shetty and Sreshth Shah.
6.53 pm We're almost ready for the presentation ceremony. By the way, this is Mashrafe Mortaza's 30th win as ODI captain. He goes past the previous highest of 29 wins by Habibul Bashar.

The Man of the Match today is Tamim Iqbal, denying Shakib Al Hasan a hat-trick of awards. He says: "It wasn't the easiest wicket. On this kind of wicket, you just need to be patient and hit the loose balls. I thought my dismissal wasn't the great, should've batted through. A score of 230-240 would've been ideal. Even thought we weren't getting boundaries, we wanted to rotate the strike. Shakib played great and so did Mushfiqur. Always a proud moment to break records (most ODI runs in a venue and first Bangladeshi to 6000 runs)."

The winning captain now. Here's Mashrafe Mortaza. He says: "We thought it'd be a 280-300 surface at the toss, but it was a difficult pitch to bat on. Tamim and Shakib were brilliant and we although we did lose a bunch of wickets in the middle, our Nos. 9,10 and 11 added 45-odd runs together. Good thing that they are working with the coaches. Fizz has been practicing with the bat, and it paid off for him. When we came out to bowl, we wanted professionalism from the boys, and they all turned up. The way boys are going, it's very good. It's important to keep the intensity and momentum - hopefully we keep it for the rest of the tournament."

Here's the losing captain, Graeme Cremer. He says: "Difficult surface here, all of them look similar, but they all play different. Toss wasn't too crucial. We went about really well with the ball, were pleased with the 216 we restricted them in. But our batting was bad. It was nice to get Tamim out (on his own bowling), and we did claw it back nicely, especially since we bowled them out. I thought we gave Bangladesh some soft wickets. It's always tough to recover after a few early wickets. We've enjoyed the tri-series so far. We've brought some youngsters like Muzarabani. We hope to make the final, but all in all, we've enjoyed our trip here, and hopefully the youngsters have learnt something."

MahfuzKamal from Japan: "Arigatougozaimashita Sreshth. Another two matches ahead for Bangladesh in this series. As a Bangladeshi fan, I wish Shakib can break another Bengali Saurav Ganguli's record. I know I am optimistic :))
6.50 pm The Bangladesh bowlers made quick work of Zimbabwe's batting. They win by 91 runs, and secure another bonus-point win. Zimbabwe drop to third on the points table after this loss.

Mushfiqur says: "The pitch was tricky. And Sunzmul and Mustafizur at the end helped us get the momentum. We had thought that 250 would be a good score. We wanted someone to make a big score, but Tamim and Shakib couldn't reach their hundreds. But also, Cremer and Jarvis were excellent, so hopefully we can learn from those mistakes. The bowling attack we have, I knew we were in with a shot. The late 45 runs got by the tailenders gave them the confidence with the ball as well. Our motto of the team is to keep the momentum going. Want to play the same brand of cricket."

commentTextItems.html: full on middle stump, and smacked over Fizz. No stopping that as the ball races away to the long off boundary

commentPreTextItems.html: MahfuzKamal: "How many records there are for a hat-trick of man-of-the-match?" -- Quite a lot actually. check this piece from ten years, written by George Binoy and Travis Basevi, that lists a bunch of them. Sourav Ganguly has the record for four-consecutive awards

commentTextItems.html: full on off, muscled towards midwicket but no run on offer

commentPreTextItems.html: full on off stump, tapped down the ground to mid off

image.longCaption: Blessing Muzarabani player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: tossed up full outside off, drives with the bat's open face behind square
good length on middle and leg, whipped easily off his pads to deep midwicket. They want the second run, and they scamper through

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Tendai Chatara c Sabbir Rahman b Shakib Al Hasan 8 (13b 2x4 0x6) SR: 61.53

commentTextItems.html: easily taken at cow corner! Full on middle and Chatara goes for the slog, comes off the bat's toe end and it's only going down the throat of the man at wide long on
full just outside off, Chatara tries to defend but the ball turns away from his bat's face. Big appeal for the caught behind or lbw, but the umpire is not interested
full on off stump, driven down the ground to long on. Firmly hit back

good length on middle stump, angling away from the tailender. Tries to poke at it with the angled bat, and the ball takes a feather-edge off the bat's surface. The ball's dipping, and forces the keeper to dive forward, but he misses the catch. Pops out of his hand as he tries to control himself. Goes down as a dropped

headshotImage.caption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: good length on middle and off, Chatara defends firmly after getting his body behind the ball

commentPreTextItems.html: Show: "How is it decided whether the winning team gets the bonus point?" -- I hear Fermat is still trying to solve that equation

commentTextItems.html: back of a length outside off, comes charging down the ground to slog this over the leg side, but he misses the shot completely. Goes under his bat and just past the outside of off stump
back of a length outside off, carved off the back foot to point. Misfield there, allows them to scamper through

commentPreTextItems.html: Mahneel: "Hi Sreshth, do you reckon Raza is currently one of the most underrated all rounders of the lot?" -- He's quite highly rated, to be honest. Wish Zimbabwe played more Tests and ODIs against higher-ranked opposition

commentTextItems.html: full on off stump, smacked back to Fizz off the front foot
good length on off stump, punched off the back foot to mid on. No single on offer
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot

commentPostTextItems.html: Sreshth is returning to take you to the end.

commentTextItems.html: back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers off the back foot
swings and connects. Length ball outside off. Reaches out and drags it to the wide long-on boundary
back of a length on the pads, goes on the back foot and misses the glance
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot

headshotImage.caption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: plumb! Beaten on the inside edge as he plonks the front leg across yet again. This length ball pitches in the corridor and nips back in. He's caught playing the wrong line and is struck dead in front of off stump. No doubt about that, and his partner tells him

Ervine has plucked out a stunner! This is something! He's leaped one-handed to his left at short midwicket and somehow got his hand under it. Superb. It's a short ball from Jarvis, on a middle and off line. The pull shot is nailed off the middle of the bat and dips on Ervine, but he's got down rapidly and done this with some craft. Despite the speed at which he had to move, he completes the catch nicely with a soft landing and a firm elbow

is that an edge? Yes it is! Bangladesh sliding rapidly. Offcutter dug in at short of a length and wide outside off. Grips the surface and climbs up as Nasir brings out the late cut. Once again he's through the shot early and the ball kisses the outside edge on the way up. Dips in front of Taylor who scoops it up

taken at short fine by Muzarabani. If the Leaning Tower ever falls, it'll look like that. Chatara bounces the advancing batsman who can't connect on the hook. Top edge hangs up and to the right of Muzarabani, who follows it like he's in a trance, stretches out his long hands, takes the catch and falls down in slo-mo

image.caption: Blessing Muzarabani player page headshot cutout, 2021
image.longCaption: Blessing Muzarabani player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Blessing Muzarabani player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Blessing Muzarabani player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: tossed up full outside off, and entices Shakib to come down the ground. Attempts to lift this over the bowler's head but deceived by the spin! Turns away from his bat, and the keeper stumps him with ease. Raza with the breakthrough
full on off stump, tries to sweep and takes the top edge. Deceived by the pace in the air, and it's caught by short fine leg

trapped in front by a googly. Doesn't pick it as he pushes forward on the front foot. He's convinced that he has no bat on this. He's walking off. Half-stride with bat behind the pad as he shapes to leave what he thinks is a legbreak outside off. Trapped right in front of off stump and that's another plumb lbw wicket this innings

outfoxes him! Cremer gets another one with the googly. Good length ball on off stump, hung up generously and dipping fast. Tamim steps out and wants to slog this over the midwicket boundary, but it turns away from him and he's woefully out of shape by the end of it all. Easy stumping for Taylor

looks like Cremer has his 100th ODI wicket. But we have to wait for confirmation because Mashrafe has reviewed this caught behind decision. This straightens in the corridor and he pokes the bat out. There is a slight sound as it passes the bat....and UltraEdge confirms that. He didn't look sure about hitting that, and asked the partner if there was a sound. But there's enough evidence. He's out

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: plumb! Beaten on the inside edge as he plonks the front leg across yet again. This length ball pitches in the corridor and nips back in. He's caught playing the wrong line and is struck dead in front of off stump. No doubt about that, and his partner tells him

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan st Taylor b Sikandar Raza 51 (80b 6x4 0x6) SR: 63.75

dismissalComment.html: tossed up full outside off, and entices Shakib to come down the ground. Attempts to lift this over the bowler's head but deceived by the spin! Turns away from his bat, and the keeper stumps him with ease. Raza with the breakthrough

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Muzarabani b Cremer 18 (25b 0x4 1x6) SR: 72

dismissalComment.html: full on off stump, tries to sweep and takes the top edge. Deceived by the pace in the air, and it's caught by short fine leg

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah lbw b Cremer 2 (7b 0x4 0x6) SR: 28.57

dismissalComment.html: trapped in front by a googly. Doesn't pick it as he pushes forward on the front foot. He's convinced that he has no bat on this. He's walking off. Half-stride with bat behind the pad as he shapes to leave what he thinks is a legbreak outside off. Trapped right in front of off stump and that's another plumb lbw wicket this innings

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal st Taylor b Cremer 76 (105b 6x4 0x6) SR: 72.38

dismissalComment.html: outfoxes him! Cremer gets another one with the googly. Good length ball on off stump, hung up generously and dipping fast. Tamim steps out and wants to slog this over the midwicket boundary, but it turns away from him and he's woefully out of shape by the end of it all. Easy stumping for Taylor

headshotImage.caption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman c Ervine b Jarvis 6 (11b 0x4 0x6) SR: 54.54

dismissalComment.html: Ervine has plucked out a stunner! This is something! He's leaped one-handed to his left at short midwicket and somehow got his hand under it. Superb. It's a short ball from Jarvis, on a middle and off line. The pull shot is nailed off the middle of the bat and dips on Ervine, but he's got down rapidly and done this with some craft. Despite the speed at which he had to move, he completes the catch nicely with a soft landing and a firm elbow

headshotImage.caption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain c Taylor b Jarvis 2 (8b 0x4 0x6) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: is that an edge? Yes it is! Bangladesh sliding rapidly. Offcutter dug in at short of a length and wide outside off. Grips the surface and climbs up as Nasir brings out the late cut. Once again he's through the shot early and the ball kisses the outside edge on the way up. Dips in front of Taylor who scoops it up

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza c Taylor b Cremer 0 (8b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: looks like Cremer has his 100th ODI wicket. But we have to wait for confirmation because Mashrafe has reviewed this caught behind decision. This straightens in the corridor and he pokes the bat out. There is a slight sound as it passes the bat....and UltraEdge confirms that. He didn't look sure about hitting that, and asked the partner if there was a sound. But there's enough evidence. He's out

image.caption: Blessing Muzarabani player page headshot cutout, 2021
image.longCaption: Blessing Muzarabani player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Blessing Muzarabani player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Blessing Muzarabani player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sunzamul Islam c Muzarabani b Chatara 19 (24b 3x4 0x6) SR: 79.16

dismissalComment.html: taken at short fine by Muzarabani. If the Leaning Tower ever falls, it'll look like that. Chatara bounces the advancing batsman who can't connect on the hook. Top edge hangs up and to the right of Muzarabani, who follows it like he's in a trance, stretches out his long hands, takes the catch and falls down in slo-mo

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza c Sabbir Rahman b Mashrafe Mortaza 5 (15b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: there's the big one! Back of a length outside off, angling away from Hammy after pitching. He tried to punch at it, but it's so far away from his body. Takes a thick outside edge, and easily pocketed by first slip

dismissalText.commentary: Solomon Mire b Shakib Al Hasan 7 (22b 0x4 0x6) SR: 31.81

dismissalComment.html: you miss, I hit! Slow and loopy on middle stump. Mire tries to slog this far too early, and plays through even before the ball got to him. Sneaks under his bat, and crashes into middle stump

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Craig Ervine c Sabbir Rahman b Mashrafe Mortaza 11 (15b 2x4 0x6) SR: 73.33

dismissalComment.html: sharp take from first slip! Back of a length on off stump, he goes chasing behind the ball that's angling away. Takes a thick outside edge, and the ball was dipping on the fielder, but he dives forward to complete an excellent catch. Zimbabwe in big trouble

dismissalText.commentary: Brendan Taylor lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: on a hat-trick! Gone first ball! Full on middle stump, but Taylor's gone back instead of coming forward. Misses the flick off his pads, and the ball raps him on the pads. Impact in front of the stumps, and Taylor's walking back. Easy lbw decision for the umpire. Taylor's horrid form continues

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza b Mustafizur Rahman 39 (59b 4x4 1x6) SR: 66.1

dismissalComment.html: drags it on. Picks the offcutter and plays what he will think is a poor shot. It's back of a length and climbing up wide outside off. He walks into it and can't get on top of the bounce. This is especially important, because the shot he's looking to play is a flick. The ball's going away from him all the time. He can only manage an inside edge onto leg stump

dismissalText.commentary: Peter Moor lbw b Sunzamul Islam 14 (42b 1x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: given out lbw. Slides past his inside edge and strikes him in front of middle stump. He was looking to defend for the turn and completely missed the line of this slider. Huge gap between bat and pad

dismissalText.commentary: Malcolm Waller lbw b Sunzamul Islam 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: lbw review. Waller has looked to play the paddle sweep first up and missed it. Looks to be struck on a middle stump line. The ball hasn't risen too much. I reckon the only way he survives this is if he has got bat or glove on it. We're waiting for Ultra Edge...no bat involved. Tracking has him dead in front. That's hitting middle and off. He's gone.

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Cremer lbw b Rubel Hossain 23 (31b 3x4 0x6) SR: 74.19

dismissalComment.html: there can be no doubt here. Cremer stuck in the crease. The ball skids in, too quick for him as he looks to flick. On the knee roll, in front of middle stump. Umpires gives it

headshotImage.caption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kyle Jarvis c Mahmudullah b Mustafizur Rahman 10 (19b 1x4 0x6) SR: 52.63

dismissalComment.html: pocketed by mid off! And it's all over. Full on off stump and smacked over the bowler's head. But no real power behind that. Taken by mid off with ease!

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Tendai Chatara c Sabbir Rahman b Shakib Al Hasan 8 (13b 2x4 0x6) SR: 61.53

dismissalComment.html: easily taken at cow corner! Full on middle and Chatara goes for the slog, comes off the bat's toe end and it's only going down the throat of the man at wide long on

notes: Bangladesh innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 45 runs, 1 wicket)
Over 5.3: Review by Zimbabwe (Bowling), Umpire - Sharfuddoula, Batsman - Shakib Al Hasan (Struck down - Review retained)
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 40.0 (Mandatory - 122 runs, 5 wickets)
Bangladesh: 50 runs in 10.4 overs (65 balls), Extras 10
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 66 balls (Tamim Iqbal 20, Shakib Al Hasan 20, Ex 10)
Drinks: Bangladesh - 82/1 in 17.0 overs (Tamim Iqbal 33, Shakib Al Hasan 37)
Bangladesh: 100 runs in 24.3 overs (148 balls), Extras 11
Shakib Al Hasan: 50 off 78 balls (6 x 4)
2nd Wicket: 100 runs in 144 balls (Tamim Iqbal 42, Shakib Al Hasan 50, Ex 10)
Tamim Iqbal: 50 off 78 balls (4 x 4)
Bangladesh: 150 runs in 35.2 overs (213 balls), Extras 11
Drinks: Bangladesh - 156/3 in 36.0 overs (Tamim Iqbal 72, Mahmudullah 2)
Powerplay 3: Overs 40.1 - 50.0 (Mandatory - 49 runs, 3 wickets)
Over 42.2: Review by Bangladesh (Batting), Umpire - C Shamshuddin, Batsman - Mashrafe Mortaza (Struck down)
Bangladesh: 200 runs in 48.4 overs (293 balls), Extras 15
Innings Break: Bangladesh - 216/9 in 50.0 overs (Mustafizur Rahman 18, Rubel Hossain 8)
Zimbabwe innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 39 runs, 4 wickets)
Over 2.1: Review by Bangladesh (Bowling), Umpire - Sharfuddoula, Batsman - H Masakadza (Struck down)
Over 10.1: Review by Zimbabwe (Batting), Umpire - Sharfuddoula, Batsman - PJ Moor (Upheld)
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 40.0 (Mandatory - 86 runs, 6 wickets)
Zimbabwe: 50 runs in 12.1 overs (73 balls), Extras 7
Drinks: Zimbabwe - 55/4 in 18.0 overs (Sikandar Raza 16, PJ Moor 9)
Over 22.5: Review by Zimbabwe (Batting), Umpire - Sharfuddoula, Batsman - MN Waller (Struck down)
Zimbabwe: 100 runs in 31.2 overs (188 balls), Extras 8
Drinks: Zimbabwe - 116/8 in 34.0 overs (KM Jarvis 1, TL Chatara 8)

milestones.description: Mortaza has broken the record for playing the most ODIs (183) for BAN, going past Shakib

stories.title: 'Hopefully Bangladesh can do us a favour' - Jarvis
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, tri-series, Mirpur, January 23, 2018
stories.seoTitle: 'Hopefully Bangladesh can do us a favour' - Kyle Jarvis
stories.summary: With his team slipping to third after a 91-run loss, Kyle Jarvis hoped Bangladesh could beat Sri Lanka comfortably in the final league game and brighten Zimbabwe's chances of qualifying for the final

image.caption: Kyle Jarvis celebrates Anamul Haque's wicket with his team-mates
image.longCaption: Kyle Jarvis celebrates Anamul Haque's wicket with his team-mates, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, Tri-nation series, Mirpur, January 23, 2018

stories.title: Shakib, Tamim lead Bangladesh's rout of Zimbabwe
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, Tri-nation series, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Shakib, Tamim lead Bangladesh's rout of Zimbabwe
stories.summary: Bangaldesh's most experienced players came to the fore on a dodgy pitch, contributing important runs before Shakib dented Zimbabwe's top order

image.caption: Tamim Iqbal and Shakib Al Hasan bump fists during their partnership
image.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal and Shakib Al Hasan bump fists during their partnership, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, Tri-nation series, Mirpur, January 23, 2018

stories.title: Zimbabwe need remedy for frail middle order
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, tri-nation series, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Zimbabwe need remedy for frail middle order
stories.summary: They stand one win away from making the tri-nation series final, but to achieve that on Tuesday, against the in-form Bangladesh side, their batsmen need to step up

image.caption: Brendan Taylor and Graeme Cremer run between the wickets
image.longCaption: Brendan Taylor and Graeme Cremer run between the wickets, Sri Lanka v Zimbabwe, tri-series, Mirpur, January 21, 2018

recentReportStory.title: Shakib, Tamim lead Bangladesh's rout of Zimbabwe
recentReportStory.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, Tri-nation series, Mirpur
recentReportStory.seoTitle: Shakib, Tamim lead Bangladesh's rout of Zimbabwe
recentReportStory.summary: Bangaldesh's most experienced players came to the fore on a dodgy pitch, contributing important runs before Shakib dented Zimbabwe's top order

image.caption: Tamim Iqbal and Shakib Al Hasan bump fists during their partnership
image.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal and Shakib Al Hasan bump fists during their partnership, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, Tri-nation series, Mirpur, January 23, 2018

recentReportStory.credit: Mohammad Isam is ESPNcricinfo's Bangladesh correspondent. @isam84

recentPreviewStory.title: Zimbabwe need remedy for frail middle order
recentPreviewStory.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, tri-nation series, Mirpur
recentPreviewStory.seoTitle: Zimbabwe need remedy for frail middle order
recentPreviewStory.summary: They stand one win away from making the tri-nation series final, but to achieve that on Tuesday, against the in-form Bangladesh side, their batsmen need to step up

image.caption: Brendan Taylor and Graeme Cremer run between the wickets
image.longCaption: Brendan Taylor and Graeme Cremer run between the wickets, Sri Lanka v Zimbabwe, tri-series, Mirpur, January 21, 2018

recentPreviewStory.credit: Mohammad Isam is ESPNcricinfo's Bangladesh correspondent. @isam84
